column4: hi can anyone help me getting gcc to work, is it pre installed or do i need to get it myself?
you need to install the build-essential package
I don't know if it is there, it is definitely in synaptic though
Thank you, I'll look into that :)
pastebin the errors you got and your /etc/apt/sources.list
(I just noticed that those are the doko debs)
(add one of the 'deb' lines to sources.list and update+upgrade)
what does it mean by this?
I figure I have to write something to sources.list, but as to what I should be writing.. that I'm not sure :/
what architecture do you use?
then you just add the line ``deb http://people.ubuntu.com/~doko/OOo2 ./'' and then run 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade'
I already downloaded the OOo2 packages (and I'm on dialup, so I'd rather not download them again); where can I put them so that ubuntu will read them instead of redownloading?
ah, ubotu knows everything :)
it's in accessories now
oh, haha
thanks
and the root terminal? (For some strange reason I can't 'su' into root)
ah, just did sudo su, and it worked
no don't do that, do 'sudo -i' instead
hi, just ask
have you tried reinstalling the libgtk1.2 package?
